explains: adj. 根深蒂固的；生根的
v. 生根（root 的过去式）

sentences.en: Racism is still deeply rooted in our society.
sentences.cn: 种族主义在我们的社会中仍然根深蒂固。

sentences.en: This tradition is also firmly rooted in the past.
sentences.cn: 这个传统也牢固地植根于过去。

sentences.en: His analysis was rooted in a somewhat tendentious reading of French history.
sentences.cn: 他的分析植根于对法国历史带有倾向性的解读。
